content: Ji-Yong ShinSearch this siteEmbedded FilesSkip to main contentSkip to navigationJi-Yong ShinAssistant ProfessorKhoury College of Computer SciencesNortheastern UniversityEmail: j.shin@northeastern.eduOffice: 342 West Village H, 440 Huntington Ave, Boston, MA 02115(Mailing address:  202 West Village H, 360 Huntington Ave, Boston, MA 02115)I am an Assistant Professor in the Khoury College of Computer Sciences at Northeastern University. I jointly run the systems research group with other faculty. I am interested in designing novel systems (operating systems, distributed systems, storage systems, etc.) and exploring formal verification methods that can be applied to system designs. Prior to joining Northeastern University, I was an Associate Research Scientist at Yale University and received my Ph.D. degree from Cornell University. [Recruiting Ph.D. students in 2025/26] I am looking for talented PhD students who are interested in systems and/or formal methods (see my research page). If you are interested in working with me, you may contact me via email (note that I may not be able to timely respond due to a huge volume of emails I get). Information about officially applying for the graduate program at Northeastern can be found here.  In the application, please indicate my name as the faculty of interest so that your application is
